entity_types.name: Company
entity_types.description: The electric vehicle and clean energy company Tesla Inc.

properties.mission: To accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy

entity_types.name: Industry
entity_types.description: The automotive and energy industries impacted by Tesla

properties.change: accelerating the transition to electric vehicles and sustainable energy

relation_groups.name: Company History
relation_groups.description: The founding and evolution of Tesla Inc.

relations.name: Founded
relations.description: Tesla Inc. was founded in 2003 by engineers Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning
relations.detail: The company was named after inventor Nikola Tesla and is headquartered in Austin, Texas.

relations.name: Leadership
relations.description: Elon Musk joined Tesla in 2004 as chairman and became CEO in 2008, leading the company through its most transformative period
relations.detail: Musk's vision, risk-taking, and ability to attract talent have been crucial to Tesla's success.

relation_groups.name: Product Development
relation_groups.description: Tesla's electric vehicle lineup and technological innovations

relations.name: Introduced
relations.description: Tesla introduced various electric vehicle models over time
relations.detail: The Tesla Roadster (2008), Model S (2012), Model X (2015), Model 3 (2017), and Model Y (2020) were launched to address different vehicle segments.

relations.name: Technological Innovations
relations.description: Tesla has developed advanced technologies to improve its vehicles and support EV adoption
relations.detail: This includes the Autopilot system, Full Self-Driving capabilities, the Supercharger network, and the Powerwall energy storage system.

relations.name: Succeeded_By
relations.description: Vehicle models that were introduced after another model
relations.detail: Model S succeeded the Roadster, Model X succeeded Model S, Model 3 succeeded previous models, and Model Y succeeded Model 3.

relations.name: Shares_Platform_With
relations.description: Vehicle models that share components and manufacturing platform
relations.detail: Model Y shares many components with Model 3, allowing for efficient manufacturing.

relations.name: Equipped_With
relations.description: Technologies that are used in or equipped with vehicles
relations.detail: Tesla vehicles are equipped with Autopilot, Full Self-Driving capabilities, and use the Supercharger network. Model S features a large touchscreen display, Model X features advanced safety systems.

relations.name: Enables
relations.description: Technologies that enable vehicle capabilities
relations.detail: Autopilot and FSD enable autonomous driving, Supercharger network enables long-distance travel.

relations.name: Has_Feature
relations.description: Specific features or technologies that a vehicle model has
relations.detail: Model S has large touchscreen display, Model X has advanced safety systems and falcon-wing doors, vehicles receive over-the-air software updates.

relations.name: Receives
relations.description: Technologies or updates that vehicles receive
relations.detail: Tesla vehicles receive over-the-air software updates that add new features, improve performance, and enhance safety.

relations.name: Supports
relations.description: Technologies that support or work together with other technologies
relations.detail: FSD system supports Autopilot, Supercharger network supports long-distance travel for vehicles.

relations.name: Integrates_With
relations.description: Technologies that integrate with other technologies
relations.detail: Powerwall integrates with solar panel systems, Solar Roof integrates solar cells into roof tiles.

relations.name: Enhances
relations.description: Technologies that enhance or improve other technologies
relations.detail: FSD enhances Autopilot capabilities, software updates enhance vehicle performance.

relations.name: Produced_At
relations.description: Vehicles produced at manufacturing facilities
relations.detail: Tesla vehicles are produced at Gigafactories in Nevada, Shanghai, Berlin, and Texas.

relations.name: Used_For
relations.description: Manufacturing facilities used for producing vehicles
relations.detail: Gigafactories are used for producing Model S, Model X, Model 3, Model Y, and other vehicles.

relations.name: Produces
relations.description: Manufacturing facilities that produce technologies
relations.detail: Gigafactories produce battery cells, battery packs, energy storage products like Powerwall and Megapack.

relations.name: Located_In
relations.description: Manufacturing facilities located in geographic locations
relations.detail: Gigafactories are located in Nevada, Shanghai, Berlin, and Texas. Tesla headquarters is in Austin, Texas.

relations.name: Uses
relations.description: Technologies used in manufacturing processes
relations.detail: Gigafactories use renewable energy sources, solar panels, and sustainable manufacturing practices.

relation_groups.name: Manufacturing and Sustainability
relation_groups.description: Tesla's approach to manufacturing and environmental impact

relations.name: Sustainable Manufacturing
relations.description: Tesla aims to use renewable energy for its manufacturing operations
relations.detail: The company's Gigafactories are designed to be net-zero energy facilities, incorporating solar panels and other renewable energy sources.

relations.name: Environmental Impact
relations.description: Tesla's electric vehicles and sustainable energy products have a positive impact on the environment
relations.detail: By producing electric vehicles, Tesla has helped reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transportation, one of the largest sources of global emissions.

relation_groups.name: Industry Transformation
relation_groups.description: Tesla's influence on the automotive and energy industries

relations.name: Industry Disruption
relations.description: Tesla has accelerated the transition to electric vehicles and sustainable energy
relations.detail: The company's success has demonstrated that electric vehicles can be desirable, high-performance, and profitable, fundamentally changing the trajectory of the automotive industry.

relations.name: Inspiring Innovation
relations.description: Tesla has inspired numerous startups and established companies to invest in electric vehicles and clean energy technologies
relations.detail: The company has demonstrated that sustainable technology can be both profitable and transformative, creating a new paradigm for the automotive and energy industries.

relations.name: Impacts
relations.description: Vehicle models that impact or transform industries
relations.detail: Model 3 impacted the mass market EV adoption, Model S transformed the luxury EV market.

relations.name: Transforms
relations.description: Technologies that transform industries
relations.detail: Autopilot and FSD transform autonomous driving industry, Supercharger network transforms EV infrastructure industry.

relations.name: Part_Of
relations.description: Sub-industries that are part of larger industries
relations.detail: Electric vehicle industry is part of automotive industry, renewable energy industry is part of energy industry.
